SENT.plain: A 2-year-old, castrated male, Australian shepherd was presented with a history of chronic mild ataxia, obesity, and lethargy
The dog was treated with levothyroxine, but the ataxia worsened
Cranial nerve abnormalities developed and the dog was euthanized
Postmortem examination revealed marked thyroid gland atrophy and widespread, severe central nervous system atherosclerosis
